channel.description: World News Today: Read the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News, Today World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News, Trending News of World - Times of India

item.title: ‘Diplomatic intervention’: Pakistan nominates Donald Trump for 2026 Nobel Peace Prize; cites role in India-Pakistan crisis
item.description: Pakistan has nominated Donald Trump for the 2026 Nobel Peace Prize, citing his role in de-escalating tensions between India and Pakistan. Trump himself has claimed he deserves the award for multiple peace efforts, including preventing a war between the two nuclear-armed nations. He also announced a peace treaty between the Democratic Republic of the Congo and Rwanda.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ‘Great day for Africa’: Trump administration brokers Congo-Rwanda treaty to end mineral war; US President says he deserves Nobel Peace Prize
item.description: Donald Trump announced a peace agreement between the Democratic Republic of the Congo and Rwanda, brokered with Secretary of State Marco Rubio, aiming to end a long-standing conflict. The deal, initiated at the DRC's request, involves halting hostilities and disarming rebel groups.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: What is Hamdan talent scale: How UAE finds the next generation of geniuses to build its future
item.description: As the UAE shifts toward a knowledge-based economy, the Hamdan Talent Scale is emerging as a national tool for identifying gifted students. Backed by science and inclusive in scope, the initiative supports future innovators through specialized education tracks, laying the intellectual foundations for a nation that aspires to thrive beyond oil, well into the century ahead.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Judge halts Trump bid to limit Harvard's foreign student intake; university scores key court win; legal proceedings continue
item.description: A U.S. federal judge in Boston has temporarily blocked the Trump administration's attempt to restrict Harvard University's international student enrollment. This decision protects the university's ability to host its 7,000 international students amid ongoing legal battles.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump gives Iran 'maximum two weeks' for decision; rules out European mediation; says 'Europe can't help them'
item.description: President Trump has given Iran a maximum of two weeks to avoid potential US airstrikes, suggesting action could come sooner than previously indicated. He downplayed European diplomatic efforts, asserting Iran prefers direct talks with the US.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Ex-JBLM soldier pleads guilty to leaking US military secrets to China; offered classified data to agents; faces 10 years in prison, fine
item.description: Joseph Daniel Schmidt, a former US Army Sergeant stationed at JBLM, pleaded guilty to attempting to share classified military information with the Chinese government. He admitted to offering national defense information to Chinese officials, both in Turkey and Hong Kong, after leaving the military in 2020.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Biden rides Amtrak to DC office; asks for ice cream; spotted 'talking in the quiet car'
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Columbia student Mahmoud Khalil case: Federal judge orders release of pro-Palestinian activist; freed after three months in detention
item.description: A federal judge has ordered the release of Mahmoud Khalil, a former Columbia University graduate student, from immigration detention after over three months. Khalil's detention stemmed from his alleged involvement in pro-Palestinian protests, sparking controversy and accusations of false information on his green card application.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump's 'Big Beautiful Bill': Senate aims for passage by this date; hopes to finalise it 'even sooner'
item.description: Senator Ron Johnson anticipates Donald Trump's "Big Beautiful Bill," encompassing tax reforms, spending cuts, and border security measures, could reach the President's desk by July. The bill aims to solidify Trump's 2017 tax cuts and introduce new tax breaks, while also proposing significant reductions in Medicaid and SNAP.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Cat fur found in kids' vest sold as '100% sheepskin' in Australia; forensic tests expose mislabeled items; sparks outrage
item.description: A children's vest, falsely advertised as Australian sheepskin, was discovered to be made from cat and rabbit fur, sparking outrage among animal rights groups. Further investigation revealed beanies mislabeled as acrylic contained fox and raccoon dog fur.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Israel-Iran conflict: UAE evacuates citizens and nationals from Iran amid rising tensions
item.description: Amid escalating conflict between Iran and Israel, the UAE evacuated its citizens and residents from Iran in a mission coordinated with embassies in Iran and Turkmenistan. Evacuees were briefly housed in Turkmenistan before being flown to Abu Dhabi. The UAE reaffirmed its commitment to diplomacy, regional stability, and the safety of its people through swift and coordinated action.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'No talks until Israeli aggression stops': Iran rejects nuclear dialogue with US after Trump sets deadline; Europe pushes to revive diplomacy
item.description: Amidst ongoing conflict with Israel, Iran has rejected any nuclear negotiations, dismissing U.S. outreach efforts. Foreign Minister Araqchi insists talks are impossible until Israeli aggression ceases, accusing the U.S. of complicity. Despite this, Araqchi met with European ministers in Geneva, as Europe attempts to de-escalate tensions.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Meanwhile in Lebanon': Missiles above, music below as Beirut party goes viral - watch video
item.description: Amidst escalating tensions between Israel and Iran, a viral video captures a surreal scene in Beirut, Lebanon, where people were seen partying as missiles flew overhead. This occurred following Israel's "Operation Rising Lion," which targeted Iranian strategic sites, including nuclear facilities, resulting in reported casualties.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Israel-Iran conflict: Major US, European airlines suspend flights to Dubai, Doha, and gulf hubs
item.description: Major airlines including American, United, Air France-KLM, and British Airways have suspended flights to Gulf destinations like Dubai and Doha due to increased regional airspace disruptions. The cancellations, driven by safety concerns, affect key travel hubs and follow official advisories urging caution. This marks a rare impact on the Gulf's typically stable aviation routes amid ongoing operational uncertainties.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Dinners, luxury baths: Florida man breaks into random house; lives there for days to avoid angry wife
item.description: A 44-year-old Florida man, identified as Joe, found himself in legal trouble after breaking into a Davenport home to avoid his angry wife following a fight. He spent several days in the house, cooking and preparing a bath, before being discovered by police acting on a neighbor's tip. Despite his explanation, he faces charges including burglary, theft, and domestic violence.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: From Holocaust to Hydrogen: How Israel built its nuclear program—allegedly
item.description: Israeli leaders have consistently refused to confirm or deny the existence of nuclear weapons. The official line—repeated by every prime minister—is that Israel “will not be the first country to introduce nuclear weapons into the Middle East.” The sentence is a masterpiece of political sleight of hand: vague enough to deflect, but strong enough to deter.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Israel-Iran Conflict: How another Middle East War is ripping MAGA apart - will Trump coalition survive?
item.description: As tensions with Iran escalate, Donald Trump faces a rebellion within his own MAGA coalition. Once united by promises to end “stupid wars,” the movement is now split between anti-war voices like Tucker Carlson, Steve Bannon, and Matt Gaetz, and hawkish figures like Ted Cruz and Marco Rubio. Vice President JD Vance remains loyally silent, echoing Trump’s shifting stance. With the base wary of another Middle Eastern conflict, Trump’s strategy of maximum pressure without direct action is being tested. The bigger battle may not be with Tehran—but within MAGA itself, as its identity fractures over the meaning of “America First.”
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Fan of Les Miserables, 95 billion dollar empire': 10 interesting things about Iran’s Supreme Leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei
item.description: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, Iran's Supreme Leader, faces escalating challenges amid Israeli strikes and regional instability. Despite his reclusive nature, Khamenei wields immense power over Iran's military, nuclear program, and foreign policy. He has built a network of regional proxies while suppressing domestic dissent, all while maintaining a surprising appreciation for literature.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Close call in Greece: Ryanair’s Boeing 737 crashes into runway barrier; wing damaged in impact
item.description: A Ryanair flight from London Stansted to Kalamata collided with a perimeter barrier while taxiing after landing, causing significant wing damage. Passengers reported a loud bang upon impact and had experienced severe turbulence during the flight's descent. Despite the incident and concerns about the proximity to fuel tanks, all passengers disembarked safely after inspections.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ‘Trump Peace Prize’: GOP’s Gaetz says Israel giving up nukes could win Trump Nobel
item.description: Matt Gaetz criticised leaders and media pushing for a US involvement in the Israel-Iran conflict, suggesting it resembles the lead-up to the Iraq War and is driven by Israel's desire for regime change. He argued that focusing on Iran's alleged nuclear ambitions is hypocritical, given Israel's undeclared nuclear program. He further argued that if Israel gave up its nuclear weapons, Trump would win the Nobel Peace Prize.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
